description:
A pure dice rolling two player game. To win the game, a player must be the first one to have all numbers from 1 to 10 either marked or locked. Two dice is used to hit the numbers. A turn, ie. rolling the dice, continues as long as results of both dice (individual results or their sum) can be used in actions.

The actions are:-
 1 mark own unmarked number,  or
 2 unlock(mark) own locked number,  or
 3 unmark the other player's marked number

At the beginning of a turn, a player is supposed lock all his remaining marked numbers (that the other player has not managed to unmark on his turn). During a turn, a player has an option to unlock some of these numbers (depending on the dice results), but can decide to not do so.

Le Super Morpion Tournant (The Great Turning Tic Tac Toe) is a "tri-dimensional turning tactical game" according to the label on the side of the game box. The game is 3D four-in-a-row game with some distinct differences from the common forms such as Score Four:

The game is for two or four players.
 The game box contains a brief rule sheet in French, a game board, and 64 beads in four colors, 16 of each color.
 The middle of the game board consists of a four by four array of 16 rods, the central four of which are placed on a turntable. Thus, the central four rods may be turned relative to the board. In the periphery of the game board is space for an additional 16 rods which may be arranged in the corners (four player game) or along the ends (two player game). Each rod is able to contain a stack of four beads.

At the beginning of the game each player starts out with 32 beads, eight of each color (two player game) or 16 beads, for of each color (four player game). All of beads are positioned at the peripheral rods at start.

On turn, each player is either placing one of his/her beads on one of the 16 central rods on the game board, or turning the central plate 90 degrees clockwise.

The objective of the game is to create alignments of four different colored beads. Each such alignment earns the player one point. The player with most points at the end of the game (when all the beads have been played) is the winner.

SPAZIO PROFONDO/OUTER SPACE is a science fiction game of exploration, colonization, war and conquest in deep space; it is a cross-over of the first edition of Twilight Imperium and of Conquest of Paradise from GMT taking elements from both.

It is a fast and easy game to play and learn, it is good to introduce new players to wargames or for a one-session evening.

The game includes:

    Easy to understand Rules
    240 Megahexes used to build the map
    Nearly 800 front-back counters including troops, colonies, planetary defences, warships, explorer and more
    27 Random events cards
    Charts and tables for easy play
    The game system is based on Kevin McPartland Conquest of Paradise (GMT) fantastic game.


Currently the game is in Italian only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.

Dragon Flight is a racing game for 2-4 players.

Using strategy and luck, players must race their dragons across a modular map, avoiding obstacles and attacks from their competitors.

On each turn players use hand cards to enable their dragon to fly at defined speeds and altitude across a modular hex map, containing obstacles of various heights, namely floating mountains.

Race your dragons through the rings, placed at various height weigh points and back home again, making best use of your cards and the available thermals (up-drafts and down-drafts) to gain and lose height.  Attack your enemies with powerful flame attacks and force them to lose control.

Players are sailors who try to reach America before the other players, starting from Europe and crossing Atlantic ocean. During the perilious travel they'll have to avoid storms, mutinies, hull crashes, winds, also thanks to Colombo's cards' help.

In order to achieve their objective they'll have to draw and play the right cards and to move their ships the fastest way possible to reach the american coasts.

Two players game: one player will take control of Danguard, hero of the humanity who will have to stop the other player evil project to harm terrestrial bases with his terrible ufo robots. Danguard will win by destroying 3 ufo robots. Ufo robots will win by occupying and destroying 4 terrestrial bases

Adventure game where players will travel worldwide, from Africa to America, from Asia to Australia. The game is divided in two main phases: during the first phase players will decide where to go, the right season, try to search a good sponsor supporting their expedition and buy the right items to survive.
During the second phase they'll leave for the expedition and try to do their best to avoid accidents and hazards also thanks to their equipment.
The winning player is the one completing the adventure first.

How many words, movie titles or famous people, can you and your team guess in 90 seconds? Set the word generator on your head, press it and a word appears. More than 2000 names, movies, objects and animals can be shown on the word generator. You're teammates can sing or yell instructions. You should lose no time to guess who or what's on your head because you have 90 seconds to guess as much words or names as possible. Ben Ik Napoleon is a party game where the fun and enthusiasm splashes.

(From the Publishers website)

Social(c) is the game of social interaction! While working together, construct a question that someone must answer. Each player gets a hand full of cards with a single word on them. As the turns go around the table, each player plays a single word. Once the question is complete, someone must answer the question. Will it be you? The question being asked is both uniquely your choice and the choices of others. Be careful though, you might be the one that must answer! Earn points based upon the words chosen in your sentence. After the question is answered, the real fun begins. Participate in mini-games that include everything from storytelling, acting, dance offs, trivia challenges, a game of craps, or a stare off. Each expansion comes with its own twists and challenges!

Social comes in several different flavors, each to meet the needs and interests of the gamer. Unlike most modular expandable games, Social does not require all previous expansions to be able to play the game. A single base kit is required along with any number of expansions to create a personalized deck of cards. Some base kits come with expansions. The purpose is to provide new gamers with popular expansions for cheaper pricing and an enhanced level of customizations to decks.

Additional expansions are able to be purchased separately.

The white label expansion includes the very basic set of Social.

Included within this tasty morsel are 189 playing cards that are sure to keep even the most loquacious gamers busy. 2-4 players. Ribbon, box, and cards included. A great starter set for any Socialite!

Source of information (Company website, Social Flyer, and Instructions).

This game takes us across the map through the large cities of Europe and the adjacent Mediterranean countries. The aim is to be the first player to put down all of his Citycards. You can do this by working the shortest route between cities. The more often you play the game the better you will know your way about the map, the better you willbe able to select your routes critically, and the faster you will be able to put down you cards.

The game is a variant from Explore Europe but without dices.

In 100 Really Dumb Things YOU have to DO while PLAYING this game, players will do some ridiculous things while laughing uncontrollably at each other. Players might draw cards that tell them to salute the nearest wall, do the Chicken Dance around the room and meow like a cat while wearing a cat nose. Other cards set off chain reactions among players. Your actions might cause players to tap their heels together and say 'There's no place like home,' do a hula dance using a tambourine, pretend to jump rope or hiss like a snake. One dumb thing definitley leads to another in this zany game of craziness!

From the box: The beautiful stained glass windows of Matthew, Mark, Luke and John need your help.  Use all of your cards to rebuild the apostles and you win Church Windows!

User summary: Players "rebuild" church windows by swapping cards from their hands to mixed up windows on the table.  Once a window is repaired, a new window in the opposite color (red or black) can be built next to the repaired window.

The player who gets rid of their cards first is the winner.

From the instructions: Peanut Butter Party is a fun, fast-paced game based on answering riddles.  Follow the friendly animals from the Peanut Butter Pond series along a path filled with special places.  Answer exciting riddles as your travel toward the pond.

User summary: Answer riddles correctly to draw "Peanut Butter Party" cards, which allow movement along the board, either one or two spaces, or to one of six designated "Special Places".  Reach the end goal (pond) and answer a final riddle to win the game.

Peculiar statistical replay game on a minor sport game, handball, dedicated to all the editions of this sport in the olympic games.
Basic system is really simple, as each team is rated for goal made and allowed, plus a killer instinct capacity (the ability to win point to point games) and a random modifier based on historical performance in the competition. Opposing teams compares values, then a die is rolled for each team to determine the final score (after a few possible modifications).
Very simple and very fast to replay an entire tournament in a very short time

You are Giraffe the hero of this game and you arrived in a small inn. Suddenly during the night something was attacking the inn. It’s a horde of ZOMBIES!!!. Nobody survive except you and the inn keeper’s daughter, Mari-chan. Survive the game in 3 nights without anyone dying.

This game is inspired by the genre tower of defense, where a horde of zombie, comes and attack the inn wave by wave. Your job is to control Giraffe, Mari-chan and occasionally Dogmeat by moving them through the inn, defending against the zombies, set barricade, buy stuff to upgrade and protecting Mari-chan while surviving yourself.

You need at least 1 six sided-die (the more the faster the game goes), 4 counters(different kind or colour) in which 1 of them represent zombie (which you need at least 7), a pencil and an eraser to jot down equipment, hp, bp and so on.

download the game here http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/2010/11/horde-of-dead-minigame.html

This is a spin and move game based on the television series Ramar, the White Witch Doctor.  The object is to lead your Safari safely through the jungle until you find the hidden treasure of the Golden Goddess.

Players spin and the player with the highest number goes first. Each player in turn will spin and move their pawn along the jungle path. If you land on one of the various assists or penalties, perform the action described. Two or more players may occupy the same space, unless you collectively decide to place them the next spot behind that pawn. You must land on the final destination by an exact spin to reach the finish. The first player to reach the Golden Goddess is the winner.

Game for ages 7-10

From the publisher:

A compact collection of card games about and with homonyms, so-called "Teekessel / Teapots". The cards show 240 photos which display everyday views as well as extraordinary motives and perspectives. The players try to discover the "Teekessel" in the pictures and to combine the cards according to certain rules.
The complexity of the games varies from easy to difficult. They provide challenges as regards perception, quickness, knowledge, wit, creativity and language competence.

The games have been designed for cross-generational playing. They can be played within the family as well as in the contexts of language teaching and creativity training. So far Teekessel im Quadrat is available only in German.

Königsberg ´45( # 104-1 ), is a boardgame covering the Soviet attack on East Prussia in 1945.

The game handles the 20 first days of the attack starting on the 13th of January 1945. The 3rd Belorussian Front under command of Cherniakhovsky launches an attack into the northeast of East Prussia while the 2nd Belorussian Front, commanded by Rokossovsky, one day later starts an attack from the south east. However, Army Group Mitte, under the command of Reinhardt, puts up an astonishing defence desperatly pushing the Soviets back.
The time is however on the Soviet side and when the defence finally crumbles there is nothing left to withstand the Soviet troops to ravage the country.

Königsberg ´45 is taught in 30 minutes and easy to digest yet a challenge even for the more experienced players. It is built around the same system of rules that shaped Stargard Solstice, KÃ¶nigsberg '45 and Army Group Narwa and utilizes a Command chit-pull system to activate HQ, which in turn allow their controlled combat units to move and attack.
Each turn is two days and the game has 10 turns.

Components:

     50 x 70cm-size map
     280 die-cut counters
     1 six-sided die
     Rules
     Box

The classic Monopoly game. This theme: A game celebrating Island life!

Players roll and move along the board to collect the properties of the Lake Erie area, in the United States. When they have a complete collection of one color, players can build houses and even hotels. If another player lands on a property, the player who's owning it, can ask rent.

The object of the game is to let the other players go bankrupt.
A tabletop dexterity/skills-based game where metallic balls are flicked in a spiral groove with many differently-scored channels. Reaching the end of each route scores points.

Total Soccer is the classic table footballs which recreate a Football game play with fingers.

It has evolved from the Subbuteo game, improving material quality and the playability, besides to have the licenses of the best football clubs around the world.

The way of playing is nearly identical to Subbuteo, player flick minature soccer players around the field to move, pass the ball, and attempt to score on the goal.

For two players, you can use only the fingers to win the match. Normally the duration is around 30 minutes (15 minutes for half).


Total Soccer es el clásico juego de fútbol de mesa que recrea un partido de fútbol con los dedos.

Es un producto que evoluciona del Subbuteo, mejorando la calidad de los materiales y su jugabilidad, además de ser licenciado por los mejores equipos del mundo.

El modo de jugar es idéntico a Subbuteo... pero con mejores componentes!!

Para dos jugadores, solo puedes usar los dedos para ganar el partido. Normalmente la duración son 30min aproximadamente (15 minutos por tiempo)

Wend-maze is a path building game in the Wend family for two to four players. The players use Wend tiles to construct a maze which they are trying to escape from. They have a series of actions they can take to place tiles, move or rotate them, switch the lights on or off, or move along the maze. They roll dice to determine the action they will take. The object of the game is to be the first player to escape from the maze.

A roll-and-move game based on the Catalan TV show "Caçadors de bolets", aired by TV3 Televisió de Catalunya. The players try to win in this particular race of mushroom hunting, correctly identifying mushroom types.

The game includes:
- board
- 6 markers
- 112 mushroom cards
- 300 cards
- rulebook

The title translates as IQ - the game of luck and logic. A player in her turn rolls a die, moves her pawn horizontally or vertically on a grid and on certain spaces gets a question (an IQ test item). If answers correctly, she gets 2, 4 or 6 points. The winner is the first player who arrives to the goal (the opposite corner) first, having at least 30 points. The game comes with 220 question cards and two additional IQ tests.

The cards all show a couple of different animal types.  There are six different animals - donkey, frog, rooster, cat, cow and pig - on the cards and there are one, two or three of them on each card.   The cards are dealt, in his turn the player turns the top card of his stack and places in front of him.

If somebody sees a series - i.e. one, two and three animals of same type on one card - it makes the noise of this animal and gets all the played cards. Player who calls 4 times first is the winner. Whomever calls wrong must give one card to other players as a penalty. Who has no cards left is eliminated.

Medieval Mastery is a board game of tactical conquest based on the feudal system that existed in Europe throughout the Middle Ages. Set in France, during a time of turmoil, each player assumes the role of a provincial lord as the country erupts into a war of succession. Send your brave knights forth to conquer the surrounding lands in an all-out struggle to claim the throne!

Medieval Mastery incorporates area control, hand management and modular board design as well as variable player powers and phase order. The rules include alternate gameplay variations. This, coupled with a modular game board and a random combination of crowns, orbs and sceptres, means that no two games will ever be the same! In addition, the number of components included allows for up to three games of varying sizes to be played simultaneously!

The game has two phases: first you have to put all the stars on the board and after this you can turn of the light and they will glow in the dark.  Now that we are in the dark the second phase starts.

Each at a turn takes away one star from the board.  The player who's star stays on the board as last wins the game.  It sounds easy but since you are in the dark, a good memory will help.

The game contains:
- A large die
- Twelve twinkling starts
- A board 
- A sandman

(User summary)

Crime & Mystery - that says it all. The players are cadets of Scotland Yard, who create stories about one of the prime suspects in a murder case using "evidence"-cards. Afterwards, all the cards are shuffled and 7 cards are drawn. On the back of the card, the players decode a question with a red foil. If you answer these questions correctly, it will lead you to the murderers.

In this game you have to listen closely, remember and combine the facts in the right way. After 2 cases (approximately 20 min.) the game ends and the points are summed up.

––––––––––––––––

In Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files, dem neuen, ungewöhnlichen Kriminal-Spiel für bis zu sechs Spieler muss man genau zuhören können, messerscharf kombinieren und braucht ein erstklassiges Gedächtnis, um an Hand der Indizien und Hinweise den oder die tatsächlichen Täter zu überführen.

Die Spieler übernehmen die Rollen von Detektiven, die eng mit Scotland Yard, der englischen Kriminalpolizei, zusammenarbeiten. Am Anfang des Spieles wird einer von vier Fällen herausgesucht. Die Spieler entscheiden sich im Anschluss daran, welchen der acht Verdächtigen sie observieren wollen, so dass sie einen präzisen Bericht über ihren Verdächtigen vortragen können. Dieser Bericht beruht auf den gezogenen Indizienkarten, die vor dem Beginn der Observation gezogen werden. Die Indizienkarten sind jeweils auf die verschiedenen Fälle zugeschnitten.

Nachdem alle Ermittler ihren Bericht innerhalb einer definierten Zeitspanne vorgetragen haben, müssen die Spieler verschiedene Fragen und Aussagen bezüglich der vorgetragenen Indizien mit den Verdächtigen in Einklang bringen.

Der Spieler, dem dies gelingt und einen Verdächtigen erfolgreich als Täter überführt, gewinnt die Partie. Ein Spiel besteht dabei aus zwei Partien, sprich zwei Fällen.

A 2 player board game.

The purpose of the game is to find as many combinations as it’s possible which sum is exactly 10. Every combination has to consist of exactly three digits situated on three neighbouring areas connected with edges or with corners. Each area can only be used once in a combination.

Players take turns finding such combinations. Upon finding one the active player may place his pawn on the board on the first or the third digit of the desired combination (never second). On any one area can only be placed one pawn. Therefore such area can be part of combination, but cannot be chosen to place a pawn on it.

The winner is the player who has found more combinations (indicated by the number of pawns on the board). If both players used the same number of pawns the winner is the player who has situated his pawns on areas which digits sum up to a higher number.

You and your rivals are locked in a struggle of heroic proportions.  Only assembling “KABOOM”, the ultimate weapon, can end the mayhem and crown you the top-dog of Superhero Land.  Use your wits to activate special powers to defuse opponents and defend yourself from the onslaught of incoming attacks.

Tic Tic Boom is the explosive new family card game chock-full of strategy and sabotage.  Set to a retro comic book motif, and manufactured on durable transparent plastic; the cards are as fun to pick up as they are to play.

Included are two entirely different games.  Tic Tic Boom “Classic” offers something for all ages and skill levels.  Players race to spell “KABOOM” on a communal board, while activating special powers along the way.  It’s quick to learn and full of surprises.  Tic Tic Boom “Advanced” is for gamers who thirst for a little more strategy, cunning, and sabotage. This game introduces Power Attacks, which are made by combining your cards to spell words such as BAM, BOOM, or K.O. These score points and provide even higher levels of high-jinx.

With more strategy than Uno and more excitement than Rummy, Tic Tic Boom is something the whole family will enjoy!

Fifth title in the Famous Five Adventure Games book series. A "make your own adventure game" based on the Famous Five children's book, "Five Go to Demon's Rocks".

Players start at the first paragraph and roll the Famous Five die to select the first step on their adventure. In subsequent paragraphs, players receive instructions about how to proceed: they must make decisions about which way to go next, roll the die, or solve clues using the included playing cards (in the shape of various tools, such as a torch or a codebook). The more clues solved, the better chance of unraveling the final mystery. And running out of provisions (picnic cards) automatically ends the adventure!

From the back of the book:

In this original series of Adventure Game Books, YOU decide what they do and whether they solve the mystery or not.

Everything you need to play the game is contained in your own Adventure Wallet. Inside it, you will find a book and a selection of playing cards including a codebook, measure card, torch, map, and rucksack — and to refresh you in your adventure, a lunchbox and picnic cards! There is even a special Famous Five dice!

The game can be played over and over again, as many times as you like. For there are a variety of routes to the solution and each route involves different clues and adventures.

From back of book:

TechCommander is a fast paced sci-fi action tactical game that puts you in the command chair of a hi tech operations center leading an elite squad on dangerous missions!  TechCommander combines miniature gaming with the sci-fi action seen in first person shooters and sci-fi real time strategy video games. The game has powerful Mechanized Strike Vehicle units (called MSV’s for short) that can destroy targets in seconds, but also has the ultimate in elite power armor infantry units.  These units are based on a possible progression of future soldier programs in development in the modern day, and are  equipped with technology to keep them agile, powerful and somewhat safe from the monster MSV’s roaming the landscape. The infantry are jump jet equipped, and in many cases, running a visibility and sensor masking stealth suit. Many also have capacitance based shield meaning if you do not fully eliminate them, they will recharge!  The MSV may be powerful, but left unguarded, it is no match for a crack squad of  USSC Force Recon Marines!  TechCommander MSVs are fairly large miniatures, standing anywhere from four inches to a foot high. They use a peg-together system so that swapping out weapons and gear for a battle that requires a custom load out is easy!

Trivia game about Dutch Artists in the Dutch top 40. It's a music trivia game. The player that answers the most questions correctly wins the game. The players have to sing a song, listen to music and guess the artist or songtitle.

The person that collects 6 chips first, wins the game.

Contents
1 rulebook
110 cards with 660 questions in 6 different categories
1 CD with 99 musicfragments
36 chips
1 dice

From the publisher:

Incredible Adventures in Energy Land is a board game created for the employees of Eesti Energia (Estonian Energy) to gain a better insight into the values of the company. It’s a family adventure game combining strategic elements with the luck factor inherent to board games.

The game route has to be created at the beginning of every new game. Thus, the game is always fresh, surprising and visually exciting. With the help from six characters - creatures connected to a certain form of energy - the player has to complete different assignments and answer questions related to different forms of energy by getting reacquainted with the basic knowledge or by learning something new.

The visual language is bright, colorful and playfully modified from different Nordic mythologies. The characters and the Energy Land itself are inspired by all the different energy forms known to man.

Spartan chess is a chess variant played on a standard 8x8 chess board. The two sides have pieces and pawns with different characteristics and capabilities. Such differences you would expect between opponents on an actual ancient battlefield.

The Black side represents the Spartans and the White the Persians. The Persians have pawns, pieces, an initial placement, and move in accord with the rules of orthodox chess.

The Spartans have two Kings and with the exception of their Kings, every Spartan playing piece moves differently from any piece found in orthodox chess.

Spartan Chess Features:
• A Persian army (white) identical to that of orthodox chess
• A Spartan army led by two Kings
• Spartan pawns (hoplites) that move differently than orthodox pawns
• Spartan pieces that move differently than any found in orthodox chess

The game's theme is based on the GameBoy Version of Nintendo's "Super Mario Land" from 1989.

Story
Princess Daisy of Sarasaland was kidnapped by the monster Tatanga. Super Mario and Luigi travel through the kingdoms of Birabuto, Muda and Easton to reach the kingdom of Tschai where the princess is held. The first player who reaches Tschai and beats the evil Tatanga and the other players frees the princess and wins the game.

Contents:

     1 Board
     8 Figures in 4 different Colors
     1 Dice
     60 Cards


Flow of Play
Each player has two figures (Mario and Luigi). Players roll a die to determine how far one of their figures can move. The board has some special places like traps and questionmarks. Traps cast the figure some spaces back. Questionmarks let the player draw one of the cards. On these player may find enemies which can be fought by a die roll or special items which let them avoid traps or enemies. The player who reaches the final place with both figures has to defeat the last enemy and the other players by rolling the dice.

Elephant Checkers is basically Turkish Checkers played on an Xiangqi Board with a extra rules and additional pieces. 
 Each player starts with 24 pieces (soldiers). The goal of the game is to leave your opponent with no moves (capturing all of their pieces does this nicely), or to promote an Elephant (a promoted Soldier) to King on the point in the center of your opponent's fortress.

As in many checker games captures are obligatory, and a player must choose the move with the most possible captures. 
 Soldiers move one square forward or horizontally. They may also capture an enemy piece (or a series of them) by jumping over it to a vacant junction beyond.

Once across the river a Soldier may move two squares or capture pieces two squares ahead or to the side, or capture a piece an adjacent piece and land two squares past it.

When a Soldier reaches the far side it promotes to an Elephant (the name source).  
 Elephants may move to any vacant junction (since Xiangqi is played on the points, not sqaures) vertically or horizontally. They capture by jumping over an enemy piece, and can continue to any empty square beyond the capture.

"They may promote to King and win the game if on the Throne point in the center of the opposing fortress, but that move counts as a non-capturing move, and can not be made when there is a capture available."

Enter the Labyrinth and Rescue the Princess is a free print and play game in which one or two players must explore a labyrinth to rescue a princess in an attempt to win her love.

The game has two paths to victory. In the first, you must try to find at least six of the princesses seven missing belongings in order to curry her favor. In the second, you must kill the labyrinth's minotaur and bring its horns to the princess to prove your courage.

The game uses a paragraph system for events. When a player lands in a square, he or she looks up that square in the paragraph book to see what happens.

In the two player game, the player who retrieves the most missing possessions wins. If one player slays the minotaur then he or she is the winner.

Wicked Wickets is a cricket based table game suitable for the whole family, cricketers and non-cricketers alike, and can accommodate anything from two to twenty-two players. The game involves selection, bowling, batting, and active fielding, allowing for short over fast action games through to the complex realms of strategy found in test play. Although, like with cricket itself, the basics are simple and easily learnt, it will inevitably take a lifetime to master.

No prior knowledge of cricket is needed to play the game which is suitable for the whole family and up to 22 players. In essence the side that scores the most "runs" wins, though selecting the right players, the order they play, and where they are positioned all affect the outcome of the game. The basics of Wicked Wickets are really quite simple; the bowler throws the ball, in this case the red ball shaped die, and the batsman "hits" it by throwing the buff bat-shaped die. Adding the scores together shows how far the ball goes using the long flight measure. If the batsman's score is higher than the bowlers, the ball "flies" in the air; if the bowler's score is higher than the batsman's, then it is struck along the ground. The yellow counter and dice are used to show which direction the ball goes. The short pace measure is simply used to measure the distance players move and the green die is mostly used for fielding. The game cards give the individual abilities of the players affecting how and where they are used. However, as with most games there is often more to it than first meets the eye. --From the publisher

Official website: http://www.boadiceasbackyard.com/

Hansel is too greedy and wants to eat all the cookies from the roof of the witch her house.  But he has to be carefull because the witch who is disguised as a pigeon will prevent him.

The board looks like a house with on top 3 places to put a card.  Shuffle the deck of cards and put three cards on these locations.  Then you put a pigeon figure on the roof in one of the three slots above a card.  There is also a Hansel figure, place this on the table.

At his turn a player may turn over a card from the deck.  If the card doesn't match the card under the pigeon nothing happens and the player may take the card.  The player can turn over as many cards as he wants.  If he wants to stop he can take all the cards that he has turned over.  But if he turns the same card  that is under the pigeon then the player has to make the sound of a pigeon and take the pigeon figure from the roof to prevent the witch from coming down.  At the same time each other player may try to take the hansel figure.  The first person who does this gets the first card of the open pile, and all the cards go to a discard pile.  So the player who turned the cards lost all his cards (except maybe one).  The witch is then put in a slot on the roof again.

A player that took Hansel by mistake has to give in a card he won in a previous round.

When the drawing deck is empty the game stops.  The player with the most cards wins the game.

Arkana MiÅ‚oÅ›ci (Arcana of Love) is an exclusive erotic card game for couples who are not afraid of new challenges.

This best-selling Polish game is close to the LCG format (living card game). In the basic box you can find 55 cards and a rule booklet. During the gameplay the participants have 5 kinds of cards (arcana, challenges, actions, counter-actions and special actions)at their disposal. Every person has 5 cards on hand and can use three of them in any combination. The game ends when one of the players (the game was designed for an unlimited number of players, but of course it will be played mostly by couples) is naked and an "arcana" card is played.

So far one expansion pack has been published, with more to come in the future.

Polish description from the publisher:

Arkana MiÅ‚oÅ›ci to bestseller na rynku gier partnerskich. Celem gry jest wzmacnianie relacji miÄ™dzy zauroczonymi sobÄ… osobami oraz efektywne urozmaicanie staÅ‚ych zwiÄ…zków. Based on famous TV show from the 1950's starring Ralph Edwards. In it, famous people would be surprised by Edwards and would wind up on his show where people from that celebrities past would appear as special guests. The object of the game was to fill in as many of the areas of the celebrities past as possible including using the Charm Bracelet for friends and family. This game lets you figure out which famous person Edwards has chosen to honor during the game.

Vintage is about the Douro River Valley of Portugal, the oldest demarcated wine producing region in the world, designated World Heritage, and the production of port wine. Each player will attempt to buy wine-growing estates and plant them with the best grape varieties to try and produce the highest quality port wine - a VINTAGE.

This game has a simple version and a normal version. The simple version is aimed at players who are not used to this kind of family strategy games. The game has fewer options and a higher degree of luck. It plays faster and is easy to learn.

With the normal version you will discover the VINTAGE game in its fullness, with many more strategic options and where luck plays a minor role. It’s a longer and more challenging game but with only slightly more complex rules.  Cheers!

The players move their five pieces with numbers on them around the board trying to put at least three of them in line with a total of 5 or a multiple of 5. They then write down the sum as score points and continue playing until one player reaches 200.

ScrumBrawl is a board game where players control fantastic creatures vying for supremacy within the Arena, scoring goals by maneuvering various types of enchanted orbs into portals set within the Arena or fighting other creatures to the death to prevent them from reaching the portals. The 100-card deck contains fifty creatures with different characteristics that determine how the creature interacts with the orbs (throw accuracy, catching ability, and throwing range), how fast a creature can move, and how effective it is in battle. Many creatures also have unique magic abilities that can be used to manipulate gameplay.

When players summon creatures, corresponding creature tokens (miniature cards that stand erect in cardstands) enter the 20x20 square gameboard, known as the Arena, where the orb and portal tokens await the contestants. In a four-player game, players may compete in teams of two. Goals are scored by creatures that maneuver an orb token onto a portal token by picking up, carrying, handing off, and throwing the orb with their creature tokens. Additionally, players can score goals (known as Skins) by successfully destroying opponents' creatures in combat. Combat results are determined by dice rolls as are the success of throws and catches of the orb between creatures. A number of Alter Reality cards allow players to change the values of individual rolls which make the outcome of every roll something that can quickly be challenged.

Enchantment cards can be played on creatures to grant them enhanced stats or new abilities as well as make them hardier in combat. Event cards, such a Lightning Storms or Fumbles can change the flow the game in seconds forcing players to constantly rethink their strategies for scoring or engaging in combat.

The game ends when a player or team reaches three goals, one of which must be a non-skins goal. No lead is safe and no two matches are ever the same making each game a unique and often humorous experience. The name is the combination of Scrum (a Rugby term where players strive for possession of the ball) and Brawl (a roaring fight, in our case, to the death). ScrumBrawl is the inaugural title for VicTim Games LLC.

Game time ranges from 20-40 minutes for a 2 player game, 30-45 minutes for a 3 player game, and 40-60 minutes for a 4 player game.

From Zillions of Games

"Pieces move diagonally but capture orthogonally. This is so as to combine the forced progression of diagonal checkers with the richness of the orthogonal game.

Object: Capture all your opponent's pieces ("Checkers" or "Kings") by jumping over them, or stalemate the opponent so he has no moves.

Checkers can move diagonally forward, by sliding to an adjacent empty square or by jumping either left, right, or forward over an enemy piece to a vacant square on the other side. Jumping over a piece captures it, but you may not jump diagonally. Capturing is mandatory, and you must keep jumping and capturing as long as it is possible, taking the maximum number of pieces.

The King is a long range piece and can slide diagonally in any direction or jump left, right, up or down over any opponent piece to any free square. When your Checker stops on the other end of the board, it becomes a King and can then also move backwards. If it merely visits a promotion square during a series capture moves, then it does not promote."

SUMMARY:

Poker Face is a board game of betting/wagering, not Lady Gaga, and money can NOT be used in playing the game. Each game consists of 7 matches. In the beginning of each match, a Match Card is drawn. Players follow the steps on the card to prepare the match, place bets and play action cards to alter the result in their favors. When the objective meets after playing rounds of action cards, the match ends. The winners receive points and the losers may receive penalty based on their bets. After 7 matches, player with the highest score wins the game.

COMPONENTS:

Board x 1
Objective Cards x 8
Action Cards x 108
Starting Player token x 1
Player token x 24
Power token x 8
Game Round marker x 1
Rule x 1


            
        
    


1) First edition is Simplified Chinese.
2) There are 36 types of action card, based on the ancient Chinese 36 stratagems.

A diceless game of strategy set in the Napoleonic era. The game comes with 3 maps: Austerlitz, Borodino and Villodrigo. The players manage one army each (either blue or white). These armies are identical with only the generals being different. The blue army appear to represent France and the white army seems more generic. This game uses a square pattern for the maps. Each square has a strength value depending of the type of terrain represented in it. For example, in squares representing plains, the cavalry unit are strongest, but it is rather different for the cities and wooded terrain types. Each army contains artillery, cavalry, infantry and guard units. The artillery units must be used by infantry or guard units, never alone. The objectives include the destruction of the opponent's army, eliminating the opponent's general or capturing cities.

Shahbol is a cross between chess and football.
The game is played on a field size of 5x8 cells. Gates occupy the first and last row of the field.
Each player has 7 pieces: 3 forwards, 3 defense and a goalie, another figure depicts the ball. Players move the one piece per turn, trying to send the ball into the opponent's gate.

Times are dire here around Dragon Valley. We're fighting off waves of orc armies, goblin war machines and even the flying lizards themselves. For now the mountain pass remains secure but our scouts have reported large gatherings in the valley and we're expecting a full scale assault before the season's end. If that wasn't enough to worry about, our neighbors are also preparing for war and petitioning the king for his troops and supplies which are already spread thin. It seems you'll not only be fighting a war of steel, but one of words as well.

In Dragon Valley, players take turns dividing items such as knights and archers, building materials for blacksmith shops and towers, special powers and even attackers. The attackers consist of dragons, orcs and battering rams that emerge from mountain passes into each player's lands. After dividing, other players select the group of items they prefer and leave the remainder with the player who did the dividing. After that, players use special cards to interfere with each others plans. The last step each round is for players to setup defenses, destroy the attackers or laying siege on the orc strongholds scattered throughout Dragon Valley.

From the Back Cover:

Colorfever is point scoring game combining a perfect blend of strategy and chance.
You draw tiles, roll the dice, and place your tile accordingly. You score by building strings of tiles horizontally, vertically and diagonally. With every turn comes the chance to draw special tiles that give you extraordinary action!

Players take turns drawing a tile of one of five colors and then placing it in one of a limited choice of columns based on a die roll. The columns are built from the bottom up, much as in Connect 4. At the end of the game, players will score for horizontal, vertical, and diagonal runs of all-different tiles and all-alike tiles. Several special tiles and board spaces create additional scoring opportunities.

2-player game based on famous painting fragment by Bernt Notke situated in Niguliste Museum, Tallinn, Estonia.

One player takes the role of god, other player takes the role of Devil. Then players compete to earn more dancers' souls.
They bet for every soul and peek bets of opponent or secret dancers' cards. 
The player who owns the more souls in the end of the game is the winner.

Components:

     Gameboard
     6 Secret dancers
     God's carddeck 
     Devil's carddeck
     Coin

In the game of CINCO, each player tries to lay down five of his own playing pieces in a row in a straight continuous line on the gameboard. The board shows 90 fields numbered 1-90. The fields where a player may place one of his pieces is limited through cards (like in 5iveStraight). There are 90 cards numbered 1-90. Each player starts with four cards. When in his turn he plays a card the number shown determines the field where he may play a piece. The number on the field must be the same or higher than the number played.
